text: The Kauaʻi Educational Association for Science and Astronomy (KEASA) is a non- profit educational astronomical organization located in Mana on the Hawaiian island of Kauaʻi. It was founded in 1989. It meets monthly for star watches. Its observatory is the largest on the island and takes advantage of Kauaʻi's unique weather and topology which provide some of the best conditions for star gazing at sea level. ==Observatory== The KEASA observatory is located on the west side of Kauaʻi at the Pacific Missile Range Facility near Barking Sands Beach at an altitude of . It is funded as a joint venture with Kauai Community College. The observatory houses the Bob Byers telescopes: * A 17-inch PlaneWave Instruments corrected Dall-Kirkham Cassegrain reflector * A Celestron HD11 * A Televue NP101 ==References== ==Further reading== * ==External links== * Category:1989 establishments in Hawaii Category:Amateur astronomy organizations Category:Buildings and structures in Kauai County, Hawaii Category:Education in Kauai County, Hawaii Category:Kauai Category:Non- profit organizations based in Hawaii
title: Kauaʻi Educational Association for Science and Astronomy
